title: Squarish Sans
content:
Just starting on a squarish sans display typeface - with the characters that give more character (aegno), not sure exactly what changes I should make next, I’m working out of illustrator, started on paper. I know these need lots and lots and lots of work still but I’m just looking for some direction. My first sans. Cheers! - Thomas.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205183049im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/squarish_sans_1_4540.jpg)

 [‹ FontLab - angled shape to a rounded shape?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205183049/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38253 "Go to previous forum topic") [A Butterfly Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205183049/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38380 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tomasu

comments.content:
I like the a and the g... very organic-. But the e and n look like you altered an existing typeface.

If the typeface is meant to be organic then make sure that this is reflected through out the rest of the design.

Mikey :-)
Hey thanks for the comment.. I was thinking similar thoughts, that some of the characters are similar to eachother but not to others. Your comment is a direction I could totally go in.. thanks!
Try flipping the a over and use that as a starting point for the e.

Patty thats a fabulous idea! Then again- you are Patty Fab!

:-)
